data.title: Make tscn the default format for better text processors / SVCs compatibility?
data.body: Shouldn't the new tscn format be default over the binary scn?

data.title: Blender-style object manipulation with keyboard?
data.body:
It'd be a great feature to have to be able to use Bldender-style node manipulation keyboard control like:

g - grab (move, translate)
r - rotate
s - scale
m - mirror

after these are initiated the user can press x, y or z to select an axis to manipulate
also using Alt modifier selects two other axis.

**Examples:**

The user presses (in order) and actions occur:
- M, X, Enter - the node is mirrored (scaled -100%) in X axis;
- G, X, 5, Enter - the noded selected is translated in axis X by 5 units;
- R, Y, -90, Enter - the node is rotated along Y axis 90 degress counterclockwise;
- S, Alt+Z, 2, Enter - the node is scale5 by 200% in axis X and Y (all but Z).

Also an action
x - delete, just like pressing "Delete" key (not htat this is using X as an action, not axis modifier!)

data.title: Particles bouncing off of collision objects?
data.body:
I'd like to be able to make particle systems react to physical world around it.
Like sparks bouncing off the floor etc.

data.title: Expose CanvasItemEditor and SpatialEditor to GDScript
data.body:
It would be great to have access to _CanvasItemEditor_ and _SpatialEditor_ from _GDScript_.
The main usage example I can think of is creating plugins that need to draw to the CanvasItemEditor's viewport (like a TileMapEditor plugin) or to the SpatialEditorViewport (like [this grass plugin](https://github.com/marcosbitetti/grass_plugin_4_godot)).

In C++ you would access these viewports this way:

``` C++
CanvasItemEditor::get_singleton()->get_viewport_control();
SpatialEditor::get_singleton()->get_editor_viewport(0);
```

But there is no way to access them from _GDScript_ unless you use some crazy tricks like this (which could stop working if the editors child structure changes):
- [CanvasItemEditor](http://godotengine.org/qa/1028/how-can-locate-the-viewport-node-of-the-2d-editor-on-the-engine)
- [SpatialEditor](https://github.com/marcosbitetti/grass_plugin_4_godot/blob/e50f2a39bcc49e605a881956ee0839127453ab01/GrassPlugin.gd#L193-L206)

data.title: Editor crashes when changing size of a CollisionPolygon2D in Segment Build Mode
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Linux Mint 17.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When changing the size of the Polygon array in a CollisionPolygon2D, the editor crashes. Although this only happens when he CollisionPolygon2D is the child of a node inherited from PhysicsBody2D.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Add a StaticBody2D
2. Add a CollisionPolygon2D as it's child
3. Click on CollisionPolygon2D and set the Build Mode to Segments
4. Click the right arrow in the Polygon row, to the right of "Vector2[0]"
5. Click the up arrow in the Size row
6. Editor crashes

Note: Replacing the parent (StaticBody2D) with anything that isn't a PhysicsBody2D will prevent the crash.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Here's a little test project with steps 1 and 2 completed
[test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/164080/test.zip)

data.title: Scaling ParallaxLayers via Script
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Win 10 x64 / Ubuntu GNOME 15.10 x64

**Issue description**
It seems that applying scale on ParallaxLayers through GDScript in _ready isn't possible / doesn't work. The value is being updated (get_scale() returns the right value) but it seems like it's not updated graphically.

**Steps to reproduce:**
ParallaxBackground
- ParallaxLayer (Scale: 0.5, 0.5)
  - some Sprites
- ParallaxLayer (Scale: 0.3, 0.3)
  - some Sprites

_ready() of ParallaxBackground:

``` gdscript
func _ready():
    for i in range (get_child_count()):
        get_child(i).set_scale(Vector2(1,1))
        if (get_child(i) extends ParallaxLayer):
            var m_scale = get_child(i).get_motion_scale()

            get_child(i).scale(Vector2(1000,1000))

            print(get_child(i).get_motion_scale())
```

data.title: (concept mockup) new gizmo controls

A new xy yz zx plane controls. The colors are a blend of the two axis they are made up of (purple, teal, yellow). These controls appear only when transform controls are turned on.

data.title: TextEdit: wrap is not implemented
data.body:
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

_TextEdit_ has method `set_wrap(bool)` which is a setter for the variable [wrap](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/gui/text_edit.h#L207). This variable is never used, so I assume this option was never implemented (or was removed).

This should be either implemented or the method should be removed to avoid confusion (like [this one](http://godotengine.org/qa/838/textedit-set_wrap-doesnt-seem-to-do-anything-thoughts)).

It's the second time in my only two games that I have such confusing problems with CollisionShape2D ( https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2804 ). 

Could you please fix these both for 2.1?

And what is the workaround for this case?

data.title: Added extra controls to GeometryInstances for controlling how shadows are cast.
data.body:
This pull request adds support for two new setttings for GeometryInstances casting shadows: they can now be double-sided or cast only the shadow. These settings can be very useful to have, especially since there's currently no way to have double-sided shadows which doesn't involve creating double-sided polygons manually and it also gives this aspect feature-parity with the Unity engine.

If you merge though, while I've left the pre-existing functionality intact so as not to break any backwards compatibility, it might be worth marking the CAST_SHADOW flag for deprecation since it is now obsolete due to the new features introduced.

data.title: TimeScale node: scale return value (time remaining).
data.body: Take the time scale into account when returning the time remaining on the input animation, rather than returning the un-scaled value.

data.title: Add option to disable margin change when anchors change
data.body:
Currently, when changing the anchors of a `Control` node, its margins would be changed as to keep the same size and position. To me, this is rather uncomfortable, as I like things to be positioned with "mathematical" precision.

Ideally, there should be some editor setting, that would control if margins are changed when anchors are.

data.title: InputMap::action_erase_event doesn't actually work
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**

Arch Linux (and again, should work on other platforms the same)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

I used `InputMap::action_erase_event` to try to make rebinding of event (e.g. I would delete the old event, and add a new one). Unfortunately, it didn't do anything at all, so I had to fall back to erasing the whole action and making it anew.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- **A:** Call `InputMap::action_erase_event`, and see it doesn't disable the event.
- **B:**
  - Clone https://github.com/bojidar-bg/top-down-inertia/
  - Run `git checkout 3ed677089325371f4053cf11ba776594c54a772d`
  - Comment out lines 96 to 98 in https://github.com/bojidar-bg/top-down-inertia/blob/3ed677089325371f4053cf11ba776594c54a772d/main/save_manager.gd#L96-L98
  - See that rebinding of actions preserves the old event too.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://github.com/bojidar-bg/top-down-inertia/ -- But follow the instructions above to disable the workaround.

Cross-ref: http://godotengine.org/qa/916/how-to-use-inputmap-action_erase_event

data.title: Enabled scrolling past end of file in text editor.
data.body: Added a togglable option to scroll past end of file in the text editor.

data.title: Post import script seems not working at current head.
data.body:
Hello.
I'm not sure but Post import script seems not working at current head.
even if most simple code like

``` gdscript
tool
extends EditorScenePostImport
func post_import(_scene)
    print(_scene)
```

is not working.

I think this is happen after this commit.
# https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/2a7fdb23b3381900c3dd087f567e50d2d738c43a

My simple example code work as expected before this commit. 
Please anyone confirm this?

data.title: startup crash with older (4 months) projects
data.body:
Well, the backtrace is this: I dunno about anything accepting this,
just testing a new update after some delay.

[New Thread 0x7fffe91a1700 (LWP 31109)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe89a0700 (LWP 31146)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe895f700 (LWP 31147)]
BOOT SPLASH: 
BOOT SPLASH IS : 

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x0000000001387b85 in StringName::StringName (this=0x7fffffffd190, p_name=...) at core/string_db.cpp:174
warning: Source file is more recent than executable.
174     if (p_name._data && p_name._data->refcount.ref()) {
(gdb) bt
#0  0x0000000001387b85 in StringName::StringName (this=0x7fffffffd190, p_name=...) at core/string_db.cpp:174
#1  0x0000000000fb1b09 in PackedScene::instance (this=0x464bd00, p_gen_edit_state=false) at scene/resources/packed_scene.cpp:67
#2  0x000000000041c99d in Main::start () at main/main.cpp:1331
#3  0x000000000040c3ed in main (argc=1, argv=0x7fffffffe438) at platform/x11/godot_x11.cpp:40

I don't have any test project at hands at the moment though (I test on https://github.com/slapin/simple-rpg, subdir godot, but it is not fully complete there, and I'm not really sure
it is a good idea to update now).
